'Domination' is the fourth full-length studio album by death metal band Morbid
Angel, released in 1995. This was Morbid Angel's last album under the label
Giant Records before the company filed for bankruptcy. The band then re-signed
with their former label, Earache Records.

The original cover is shown here. Today, a different cover exists with the
picture shown at a different angle. Initial copies came in a green jewelcase.
There was also a limited edition "Slime Pack" planned, which was never
released after several packs leaked before shipping and the slime-substance
was found to be toxic.

A music video was produced for the song "Where the Slime Live".

David Vincent left the band soon after the release of Domination and was
replaced by Steve Tucker. Vincent returned to the band in 2004 but it would not
be until the release of [[Illud Divinum Insanus]] in 2011 that he would appear
on new Morbid Angel recordings.
